intro: Micromeria parviflora f. multiantha, commonly known as the multibract micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and often pink or purple in color. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphological features.
